sectionText: This course presents an overview of the study of social movements from a (critical) communicative/rhetorical perspective. The focus will be on the rhetorical and discursive dimensions of social movement, including agents, audiences, tactics, communication media, and the contexts of social change. The first half of the course will review the history of social movement scholarship within rhetorical studies and the second half will survey major concepts and methodologies for the study of social movements.
